meanings.definition: To put in a particular place or position.
meanings.sent1: She emplaces the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He always emplaces his keys on the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat emplaces itself on the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The sun emplaces its rays across the sky at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully emplaces each flower in the garden bed.

meanings.definition: To establish or set in a particular location.
meanings.sent1: The company emplaces its headquarters in the city.
meanings.sent2: They emplace a new rule for the team to follow.
meanings.sent3: The chef emplaces a secret ingredient in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His words emplace a sense of calm in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist emplaces her signature at the bottom of the painting.
